column1: id,"blog","category","markdown","sg_id"

309,"WN276","Programming","[GeometaLab](http://www.ifs.hsr.ch/index.php?id=12520) of Hochschule Rapperwil, Switzerland announced: We're actually evaluating the many @Docker versions of #Nominatim #DockerHub and analyzing performance bottlenecks!"" ",3

330,"WN276","Programming","The Node.js module [csvgeocode](https://github.com/veltman/csvgeocode) can convert [lists of geographical coordinates in an address list](http://www.fulcrumapp.com/blog/geocoding-data-with-NodeJS). As backend services Google, Mapbox, OSM Nominatim, Mappen or Texas A & M's can be used.",3

743,"WN283","Community","A complaint from John Goodman at talk about the incorrect search behavior on the page led to an [interesting discussion](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2015-December/075195.html) about existing and missing functionality of Nominatim and the main page.",3
781,"WN284","Community","Discussion about Nominatim and its surprising search results [continues](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2015-December/075195.html)",3
1102,"WN289","Software","The layout of [nominatim.openstreetmap.org](http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org) has been changed. The detail page especially, has been improved considerably!",3
1250,"WN292","Releases","

column5: Changes in rendering, various bug fixes and minor improvements.

column1: provided by the [OSM Software Watchlist](http://osm.wno-edv-service.de/index.php/osm-software)",3
2881,"WN322","Releases","

column5: Bug fix release with minor fixes
Eight extensions, six changes and 2 fixes
Fixed GPX output format, support portuguese, some other fixes
Eliminates GPS problems, improved audio via Bluetooth, further changes and improvements
Improved user interface, refined POI search
Improved user interface, refined POI search

column1: Provided by the [OSM Software Watchlist](https://osm.wno-edv-service.de/index.php/osm-software).
( ) unfree software. See [freesoftware](https://fsfe.org/about/basics/freesoftware.en.html).",3

3859,"WN342","Programming","Mariusz Rogowski complains on the [dev mailing list](http://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/dev/2017-February/029682.html) about the quality of Nominatim and the project's ability to attract new developers. Sarah and Frederik give detailed answers and, among other things, clarify why erroneous code is not included in the project.",3

4789,"WN362","Releases","Version 3.0.0 of [Nominatim](https://github.com/openstreetmap/Nominatim/releases/tag/v3.0.0) is now out. The result is a much smaller database and improved query response times. The most important feature is undoubtedly the on-the-fly address interpolation, as it makes sense to address blocks of houses that are particularly popular in North and South America. Sarah Hoffmann, aka lonvia told us, that Nominatim has now officially moved to openstreetmap.org on GitHub and [nominatim.org](http://nominatim.org/) is currently being expanded into the official homepage.",3
4810,"WN362","Releases","

column5: Next fix of stray images upload problems.
Many changes, please read release info.
Mapzen map: several improvements, Mapstyle: Kurviger style is the default style.
Many changes during the last days, please read release infos.
New database format. Please read release info.

column1: Provided by the [OSM Software Watchlist](https://wambachers-osm.website/index.php/osm-software). Timestamp: 2017-06-26 18:14:22+02 UTC
( ) unfree software. See: [freesoftware](https://fsfe.org/about/basics/freesoftware.en.html).",3
6204,"WN392","Software","Sarah Hoffmann [explains](http://www.openstreetmap.org/user/lonvia/diary/43143) the modified handling of post code areas and tags in Nominatim.",3

6967,"WN408","OpenStreetMap Foundation","An FAQ of the OSM Foundation [answers](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Services_and_tile_users_privacy_FAQ) several data protection questions currently asked by many website operators who integrate services of the OSM Foundation (tile.openstreetmap.org, nominatim.openstreetmap.org, api.openstreetmap.org).",3

7090,"WN412","OSM in action","Google Maps currently disallows access without an API key, as announced. This caused an [inrush](https://munin.openstreetmap.org/openstreetmap/dulcy.openstreetmap/nominatim_requests.html) of requests on the OpenStreetMap Foundation Nominatim server.",3

7643,"WN423","Releases","Nominatim 3.2.0 has been [released](https://github.com/openstreetmap/Nominatim/releases/tag/v3.2.0). GeoJSON and GeocodeJSON have been added as new output formats. The reverse geocoding algorithm has been  rewritten to improve results in sparsely populated areas and when looking up administrative entities.",3
9403,"WN459","Programming","This year 5 projects were [accepted](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Google_Summer_of_Code/2019) for Google Summer of Code:
_Iason Manoloudis_: `3D Traffic Sign Rendering in OSM2World`
_Thomas Hervey_: `HOT Task Manager Integration`
_Tanya Haddad_: `Adding Wikidata to Nominatim`
_Vishal R_: `Tool to Generate Bounding Nodes for Buildings and Quality Assurance`
_Ashish Singh_: `JOSM's PT_Assistant plugin`",3

9747,"WN467","Programming","tchaddad [detailed](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/tchaddad/diary/390156) the work done on the [Google Summer of Code](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Google_Summer_of_Code/2019/Accepted_projects) project to add data from Wikidata to Nominatim. The first step, according to the blog post, is the update and improvement of the existing Wikipedia extraction scripts.",3

9972,"WN472","Programming","Wikidata, Wikimedia's project to create a store of structured knowledge, has the potential to improve the calculation of importance scores in Nominatim. For instance, where real-world items have identical names, the ability to differentiate between OSM locations using properties not covered by OSM could help with returning more relevant geocoding results.

tchaddad, who is working on a [Google Summer of Code project](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Google_Summer_of_Code/2019/Accepted_projects), [gives](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/tchaddad/diary/390379) an introduction to Wikidata and how entries are stored and extracted using the Eiffel Tower as an example. How Wikidata could be used to assist Nominatim is described.",3

10160,"WN476","Programming","tchaddad [explains](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/tchaddad/diary/390593), in his user diary, how Wikidata queries using SPARQL and the API work, and how Wikidata could be used to improve Nominatim.",3

11961,"WN516","OSM in action","Michael Norelli [used](https://twitter.com/neogeo360/status/1267912928700723201) the QGIS MMGIS plugin to geocode 48,000 local addresses with Nominatim. This drastically reduced the number of addresses which he then geocoded using Google services. This demonstrates that even if not all addresses are mapped, an astute user can still make use of them. Users should mind the [Nominatim Usage Policy](https://operations.osmfoundation.org/policies/nominatim/).",3

12132,"WN519","Software","Release of [Nominatim version 3.5.1](https://github.com/osm-search/Nominatim/releases/tag/v3.5.1) has bug fixes for two important issues with osm2pgsql (see osm2pgsql new release above):
osm2pgsql might get stuck during updates when running with Postgresql 12;
osm2pgsql might hang when processing extremely complex multipolygons.",3

12375,"WN524","OpenStreetMap Foundation","[Guillaume Rischard](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Stereo) [announced](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2020-August/085174.html), on talk, the funding of three infrastructure projects: Nominatim, osm2pgsql and Potlatch 2 by the OSMF Board. Technical issues were discussed among others by [Sören Reinecke, Richard Fairhurst](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2020-August/085179.html) and [mmd](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2020-August/085200.html).",3

12564,"WN528","OpenStreetMap Foundation","The OSM Foundation is [funding](https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Board/Minutes/2020-08#2020.2FRes38_Funding_of_projects_used_in_core_infrastructure_.28Nominatim.2C_osm2pgsql.2C_Potlatch.29) the development of [Nominatim](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim), [osm2pgsql](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Osm2pgsql), and [Potlatch 2](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Potlatch_2).",3

12675,"WN530","Software","This year Nominatim celebrates its 11th birthday. On 11 November 2009, the OpenStreetMap (OSM) homepage used Nominatim as its main search engine for the first time. Since then OSM has grown enormously and with it the need for a geocoder based on OSM data. The OSM Nominatim servers alone now serve more than 30 million queries per day. [Read](https://nominatim.org/2020/09/14/Quo-Vadis.html) more about the present and future for Nominatim.",3

12709,"WN531","Community","The 35th edition of the [Geomob Podcast](https://thegeomob.com/podcast/) [features](https://thegeomob.com/podcast/episode-35) an interview with Sarah Hoffmann who, as a software developer, is responsible for the maintenance of Nominatim, the most important software for [geocoding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geocoding) used by OpenStreetMap. Sarah explains the technical aspects and challenges of managing a technically complex and publicly visible open source project.",3

12832,"WN533","Community","The Italian user Cascafico [described](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Cascafico/diary/394336) his attempts to put the Italian schools 'in their place', an exercise, in his opinion, almost desperate, given the uneven situation of OSM civic numbers in Italy and given the (for the moment) poor flexibility of the Nominatim geocoder. It remains an exercise because we are waiting to clarify the licence (IODL) of the source data.",3

12854,"WN534","Mapping","Sarah Hoffmann (aka lonvia) [informs](https://nominatim.org/2020/10/07/about-addr-tags.html) us, in her blog post, how [Nominatim](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim) can be used to search for addresses and how Nominatim also now uses the `addr: ` tags recorded in OSM to determine addresses precisely.",3

12942,"WN536","Programming","Sarah Hoffmann, aka lonvia, [reports](https://nominatim.org/2020/10/21/photon-country-extracts.html#) that the download server for Photon now has ready-to-use database dumps for over 200 countries.",3

13376,"WN546","Did you know that …","... that the US National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency [runs](https://osm.gs.mil/) their own OpenStreetMap instance, including their own base map (with English language names in brackets after local non-Latin ones), Nominatim, overpass turbo, and OSRM routing). It's only provided for US Government 'authorized' use only, so don't go too crazy and do something unauthorised.",3

13743,"WN554","Software","Nominatim, the open-source geocoding tool based on OpenStreetMap data, [introduced](https://nominatim.org/2021/02/25/nominatim-tool.html) a command-line version leading to many changes such as much less fiddling with PHP scripts.",3

13751,"WN554","Releases","[Version 3.0](https://nominatim.org/2021/02/27/nominatim-ui-3dot0.html) of Nominatim-UI adds theming and other features which make the user interface independent from the standard installation on openstreetmap.org servers.",3

14153,"WN564","Programming","Nominatim's developers [explained](https://nominatim.org/2021/05/06/normalization.html) the importance of normalising various kinds of text strings, such as place names, name elements and queries, when processing OSM data for geocoding. They are in the process of re-factoring the current implementation to allow both ease of maintenance and more localised usage of the normalisation rules.",3

14308,"WN568","Programming","As part of the Summer of Code, four people [showed](https://summerofcode.withgoogle.com/organizations/5879437586857984/#!) what they are working on to improve OpenStreetMap software:
- [Vuong Ho](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/goodudetheboy/diary/396842) – Opening hours tag evaluator
- [Yash Srivastava](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Darkshredder/diary/396834) – Interface for reporting search bugs for Nominatim
- [Antonin Jolivat](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/AntoJvlt/diary/396837) – QA Reports Extraction Tool
- [Zohaib Ansari](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/zohaib_/diary/396844) – Element History Widget",3

14454,"WN572","Programming","Sarah Hoffmann [gave](https://nominatim.org/2021/07/03/abbreviations.html) an overview of how Nominatim handles abbreviations, such as St. in english (for Street or Saint).",3

14495,"WN573","Software","AntoJvlt [gave](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/AntoJvlt/diary/397151) a few insights into his Google Summer of Code project 'Nominatim QA Analyser Tool', capable of analysing Nominatim’s database to extract suspicious data from it and presenting the results in a graphical interface so they can be corrected.",3

14533,"WN574","Software","Darkshredder gave an [update](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Darkshredder/diary/397215), illustrated with screenshots, about his Google Summer of Code Project. The Nominatim Feedback Reporter will allow users to submit OpenStreetMap search (Nominatim) errors. These can then be added as test cases by the developers.",3

14662,"WN578","Software","Yash Srivastava gave a final [update](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Darkshredder/diary/397215), illustrated with screenshots, about his Google Summer of Code Project. The Nominatim Feedback Reporter will allow users to submit OpenStreetMap search (Nominatim) errors. These can then be added as test cases by the developers.",3
14700,"WN579","Programming","The final reports for projects that were part of the 2021 Google Summer of Code are in:
[Vuong Ho's](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/goodudetheboy/diary/397439) opening hours tag evaluator
[Zohaib Ansari's](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/zohaib_/diary/397493) stand-alone library to display multiple versions of any selected OSM element and allow comparison between different versions
[Antonin Jolivat's](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/AntoJvlt/diary/397480) Nominatim QA reports extraction tool.",3

14930,"WN586","Software","Sarah Hoffmann [discussed](https://nominatim.org/2021/10/10/detecting-languages.html) some of the issues encountered when trying to deal with names in different languages or mixed-lingual names. The next version of Nominatim will support language-specific handling of names, including for names that do not have a language suffix.",3

15080,"WN590","Releases","Sarah Hoffmann [presented](https://nominatim.org/2021/11/03/release-40.html) version 4.0.0 of Nominatim, now available with a more flexible approach to handling how places can be searched.",3

15384,"WN600","Mapping","Clifford Snow [found](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2022-January/087215.html) that Nominatim's [QA tool](https://nominatim.org/qa/) is very good for cleaning up existing data in preparation for building and address imports.",3

15621,"WN606","Programming","[RadicallyOpenSecurity](https://www.radicallyopensecurity.com/) (ROS) has [audited](https://nominatim.org/2022/02/23/security-audit.html) the security of Nominatim's codebase and data.",3

15689,"WN608","OpenStreetMap Foundation","Paul Norman [explained](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/pnorman/diary/398773): the usage polices for Nominatim and OSM Map Tiles, automatic blocking, and how to fix too frequent requests.",3

15692,"WN608","Software","[RouteXL](https://www.routexl.com/) is a web appplication using OpenStreetMap data for road itinerary planning, with optimisation for multiple stops to save travel time and cost. It is free to use for routes of up to 20 stops. Various geocoders can be selected including Nominatim.",3

16231,"WN623","Software","Sarah Hoffmann [blogged](https://nominatim.org/2022/06/26/state-of-postcodes.html) about the current status of postcodes in OpenStreetMap, explaining their usefulness and offering a QA layer for incorrectly formatted postcodes.",3

16313,"WN626","Programming","Sarah Hoffmann [described](https://nominatim.org/2022/07/19/python-types.html) how  type annotations have been added to Nominatim's Python code in order to improve software maintainability, and also explained some lessons she learned in the process.",3

16397,"WN629","Releases","Sarah Hoffmann (lonvia) proudly [announced](https://nominatim.org/2022/08/05/release-41.html) the release of Nominatim 4.1.0. Also check out the new [Nominatim Cookbook](https://nominatim.org/2022/08/06/nominatim-cookbook.html).",3

16413,"WN630","Did you know that …","... if you are using the Greasemonkey Addon for the Firefox browser, there's a powerful script that gives you multiple ease-of-use changes for openstreetmap.org? You will have direct access to Mapillary and KartaView links that point to the same map area and multiple tools from a sidebar such as OSMCha (for Changesets), OSM Deep History, and Nominatim (for other Objects), or a link to create an overpass history request when you’re looking at a note. Also, when you’re viewing your 'My Notes' page, you will have the option to filter only unresolved notes for a better overview. You can see the development process on [GitHub](https://github.com/OSM-de/osm-org-greasemonkey), or you can [install the script](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/OSM-de/osm-org-greasemonkey@master/osm-org-greasemonkey.user.js) directly into Greasemonkey.",3

16921,"WN644","Releases","Nominatim 4.1.1 has been [released](https://nominatim.org/2022/11/20/release-411.html). This is a bugfix release, which resolves some issues around the updating of databases and search.",3

16942,"WN645","Programming","Sarah Hoffmann, aka Lonvia, [reported](https://nominatim.org/2022/11/28/towards-flex.html) that she has built experimental support for osm2pgsql's '[flex output](https://osm2pgsql.org/doc/manual.html#the-flex-output)' into the latest version of Nominatim with funding from [Geofabrik](https://www.geofabrik.de/). This will make it possible in the future to run map rendering and geocoding from the same database.",3

17016,"WN647","Programming","Sarah Hoffman (lonvia) [described](https://nominatim.org/2022/12/08/frontend-renovation.html) how the frontend of Nominatim will now be rewritten in Python from the current PHP whilst also introducing significant enhancements. A major change will allow a local Nominatim instance to be run without a web server. The work is supported by [NGI0 Entrust](https://nlnet.nl/project/Nominatim-lib/).",3
17201,"WN652","Did you know that …","… there are special [phrases](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim/Special_Phrases) that cause Nominatim to search for a specific `key",3

17294,"WN655","Programming","Sarah Hoffmann [reported](https://nominatim.org/2023/02/06/nominatim-lite.html) on an initial experiment with using Nominatim and SQLite. This is part of the work being done to make Nominatim work better with with less powerful hardware.",3

17622,"WN664","Programming","Sarah Hoffmann [reports on](https://nominatim.org/2023/04/03/reverse-performance.html) her progress with using Python for reverse geocoding on Nominatim instead of PHP.",3

17833,"WN671","Programming","Sarah Hoffmann [wrote](https://nominatim.org/2023/04/27/improving-search.html) about refreshing the search algorithms being used in Nominatim and how the Python rewrite is allowing readjustments of the algorithm for improved matching.",3

18058,"WN678","OSM in action","[1] Home Assistant, an open source _home automation_ application, now [uses](https://github.com/home-assistant/frontend/pull/17287) OpenStreetMap and Nominatim in its user _onboarding_ feature.",3

18084,"WN678","Education","Miku has [released](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/miku0/diary/401914) a progress report on her Google Summer of Code 2023 project. The project focuses on customising Nominatim's address lookup algorithm based on the address system used in Japan.",3

18122,"WN680","Software","Raster tile provider [Tracestrack](https://www.tracestrack.com) has open sourced [Tracesmap](https://tracesmap.com), their generic online map, on [GitHub](https://github.com/tracestrack/tracesmap.com). The map integrates many OpenStreetMap based services such as Tracestrack raster tiles, OpenRouteService, Overpass API, Nominatim search and OpenRailwayMap, as well as some commercial products like Mapbox satellite imagery, and TomTom Traffic.",3

18181,"WN682","Software","After a six month development process, Sarah Hoffmann (lonvia) [presented](https://nominatim.org/2023/08/13/going-live.html) the rewritten search frontend now available on [Nominatim](https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org).  She also explained the changes that have been made to the Nominatim API.",3

18261,"WN684","Programming","miku0 has [posted](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/miku0/diary/402263) a final update on their Google Summer of Code project enhancing Nominatim's address search in Japan.",3
18461,"WN690","Releases","Sarah Hoffmann [announced](https://nominatim.org/2023/10/07/release-43.html) the release of Nominatim version 4.3.1.",3

18657,"WN696","Software","Sarah Hoffmann [reported](https://nominatim.org/2023/07/24/performance-revisited.html) on an experiment to improve the performance of the Nominatim Python frontend by tuning SQLAlchemy. This optimisation successfully improved the performance of the Python frontend, although it is still not as good as the previous PHP implementation.",3

18683,"WN696","Software","Sarah Hoffmann [announced](https://nominatim.org/2023/11/20/release-432.html) the release of Nominatim versions 4.3.2 and 4.2.4. These versions contain fixes for SQL injection security holes in the Nominatim CLI.",3

18732,"WN698","Software","The NLnet Foundation has [announced](https://nlnet.nl/news/2023/20231123-announcing-projects.html) its new funding projects for their next funding round. Among them are two from the OpenStreetMap ecosystem: [Umap](https://nlnet.nl/project/uMap/) (collaborative custom mapping with OpenStreetMap data) and [Protomaps](https://nlnet.nl/project/Protomaps/) (self-hostable maps based on OpenStreetMap data). The NLnet Foundation has previously funded several OpenStreetMap-based projects, including StreetComplete, MapComplete, and Nominatim.",3

18919,"WN701","Software","The Roadmap to Nominatim 5 has been published and the [plan](https://nominatim.org/2023/12/19/roadmap-nominatim5.html) is for the next version to be leaner and easier to use. Version 5 will see the transition to a pure Python package, removal of PHP, and the unbundling of osm2pgsql. The roadmap includes gradual changes leading to the first major version of Nominatim 5 in the fourth quarter of 2024. It will become possible to install Nominatim via pip.",3

19390,"WN712","Releases","Sarah Hoffmann [announced](https://nominatim.org/2024/03/08/release-440.html) the release of Nominatim version 4.4.0 and Photon version 0.5.0. This release comes with bug fixes and performance improvements and a new, experimental feature for exporting a Nominatim database to SQLite.",3

19707,"WN719","Mapping","Lucas Longour [presented](https://lucaslongour.org/posts/2024-04-28-mapping-possibly-outdated-osm-data/) a project to prioritise updates to OpenStreetMap by focusing on the ages of points of interest. The project uses a web tool to input locations, fetches data using the Nominatim API to derive bounding box coordinates, and generates queries to the Overpass API to identify points of interest such as restaurants and hotels.",3

20275,"WN732","Programming","osm-nominatim-geoserver-postgis [provides](https://github.com/geotekne-argentina/osm-nominatim-geoserver-postgis) a Docker-based setup for creating a personal OpenStreetMap tile server with geocoding capabilities, using Nominatim and Geoserver to process and serve OSM data through a local PostGIS database.",3

20280,"WN732","Programming","The DEV Community [showed](https://dev.to/syamaner/building-a-custom-reverse-geocoding-resource-for-net-aspire-2n9o) how to build a custom reverse geocoding resource using .NET Aspire. Setting up a Nominatim API with Docker containers, managing startup dependencies, and implementing health checks was covered in the article.",3

20316,"WN733","Releases","Nominatim has [released](https://nominatim.org/2024/08/07/wikimedia-file.html) a new Wikimedia-based scoring file that uses data from Wikipedia and Wikidata to assign importance scores to places, allowing for more accurate geocoding, with the updated file now available in a streamlined CSV format.",3

20336,"WN733","Software","William Edmisten [reviewed](https://wcedmisten.fyi/post/how-to-query-osm/) six open source tools for querying OpenStreetMap data, including overpass turbo for web-based filtering, osm2pgsql combined with PostGIS for geospatial database queries, DuckDB's experimental `ST_ReadOsm()` function for direct file queries, QLever for RDF-based querying with SPARQL, Nominatim for geocoding based on textual input, and Pelias, which uses Elasticsearch for robust geocoding. William discussed the strengths, limitations, and setup procedures of each tool.",3

20569,"WN739","Releases","Sarah Hoffmann [announced](https://nominatim.org/2024/09/12/release-450.html) the release of Nominatim version 4.5.0, a transitional update in preparation for the upcoming Nominatim 5.0, which will be a purely Python-based application.",3

21438,"WN760","Programming","Sarah Hoffmann has been [selected](https://nominatim.org/2025/02/06/sovereign-tech-fellowship.html) for the one-year pilot of the [Sovereign Tech Fellowship](https://www.sovereign.tech/news/meet-the-sovereign-tech-fellows

) programme by the Sovereign Tech Agency. The fellowship will provide support for the maintenance of Nominatim, Photon, [osm2pgsql](https://osm2pgsql.org/news/2025/02/06/sovereign-tech-fellowship.html), and pyosmium throughout the next year. Congratulations Sarah!",3

21464,"WN760","Releases","Nominatim 5.0.0 has been [released](https://nominatim.org/2025/02/07/release-50.html), completing its transition to a Python package by removing the PHP front end and bundled osm2pgsql, while introducing a reworked osm2pgsql import style configuration, better integration with osm2pgsql-themepark, and new pre-processing hooks for search queries, including improved handling of Japanese addresses.",3
